title: Quick Conversion Tricks
description: Learn mental shortcuts and patterns for faster number system conversions.

sections.title: Conversion Shortcuts and Patterns
sections.content:
After learning all the formal methods, let's discover shortcuts that make conversions lightning-fast!

**Powers of 2 Recognition:**
Memoriz these common values:
• 2¹ = 2
• 2² = 4
• 2³ = 8
• 2⁴ = 16 (also 10 in hex!)
• 2⁵ = 32
• 2⁶ = 64 (also 40 in hex!)
• 2⁷ = 128 (also 80 in hex!)
• 2⁸ = 256 (also 100 in hex!)
• 2⁹ = 512
• 2¹⁰ = 1024 (1K!)

**Common Hex Values:**
• FF = 255 (max byte!)
• 80 = 128 (high bit of byte)
• 100 = 256
• 3FF = 1023
• FFF = 4095

**Binary Doubling/Halving:**
Shift left = multiply by 2:
• 1010 << 1 = 10100 (10 becomes 20)
Shift right = divide by 2:
• 1010 >> 1 = 101 (10 becomes 5)

**Nibble Thinking (4-bit groups):**
Think in hex chunks:
• 10101010 = AA (1010=A, 1010=A)
• 11110000 = F0 (1111=F, 0000=0)

**Quick Binary to Hex:**
Memoize these 16 patterns:
0000=0, 0001=1, 0010=2, 0011=3
0100=4, 0101=5, 0110=6, 0111=7
1000=8, 1001=9, 1010=A, 1011=B
1100=C, 1101=D, 1110=E, 1111=F

**Decimal to Hex Shortcuts:**
• 255 = FF (always!)
• Multiples of 16: 16=10, 32=20, 48=30, 64=40
• Add: 17 = 16+1 = 10+1 = 11 (hex)

**Pattern Recognition:**
• All 1s in binary = power of 2 minus 1
  - 111 = 7, 1111 = 15, 11111 = 31
• Alternating bits: often simple fractions
  - 101010 = AA (hex) = 170 (decimal)

**Mental Math Tricks:**
• To convert small hex to decimal: multiply first digit by 16, add second
• 2F = 2×16 + 15 = 32 + 15 = 47
• For binary, add powers of 2 where bits are 1
• 1101 = 8+4+1 = 13

sections.title: Quick Pattern Recognition
sections.description: Let's use shortcuts to convert quickly!

exercise.problem: What is hex FF in decimal? (use the shortcut)
exercise.explanation: FF is the maximum value for one byte, which is always 255. This is a fundamental value to memorize!
hints: This is the max byte value

questions.questionText: Hex FF always equals ____ in decimal.
questions.explanation: FF = 15×16 + 15 = 255. This is the maximum value for one byte and should be memorized!
2¹⁰ = 1024, also known as 1K (kilobyte). This is a fundamental computer value.

questions.questionText: Shifting binary left by 1 position multiplies the value by 2.
questions.explanation: True! Left shift adds a 0 on the right, which doubles the value. Example: 101 (5) << 1 = 1010 (10).
hints: Think about what happens to place values

questions.questionText: Quick! What is hex 10 in decimal?

questions.explanation: 1111 in binary = 15 in decimal = F in hex. All bits on in 4-bit nibble = F!
2⁸ = 256. This is also hex 100, and it's one more than the max byte value (255).

questions.questionText: Each hex digit represents exactly 4 binary bits, making binary-hex conversion very fast.
questions.explanation: True! This perfect 4-to-1 relationship is why hex is so useful in computing. Just group 4 bits and convert each group.
